lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

lust.question: Have I committed any acts outside of marriage that simulated or promoted lust?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: through excessive thoughts about idle activities
prodigality.question: Have I squandered God's precious time for meaningless pursuits through excessive thoughts about idle activities?
prodigality.description: Wasteful pursuits squander the precious time God has given us for meaningful spiritual growth and service to others.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I engaged in excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively risked financial resources entrusted to me, giving precedence over my responsibilities to support family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: over my household 's needs and responsibilities

prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

sensuality.question: Did I desire worldly experiences over growth in faith?
sensuality.description: Prioritizing worldly pleasures and experiences over spiritual development is considered sinful as it violates the First Commandment by placing temporal desires above one's eternal relationship with God.

sensuality.question: Did I use controlled substances to impair my self-control?
sensuality.description: Using controlled substances deliberately impairs your God-given reason and free will, and an attempt to avoid dealing with life's challenges rather than facing them with God's help.

sensuality.question: Did you use controlled substances to impair your God-given reason and free will?
sensuality.description: Using controlled substances deliberately impairs your God-given reason and free will, and an attempt to avoid dealing with life's challenges rather than facing them with God's help.

sensuality.question: Did you deliberately use controlled substances to impair your God-given reason and free will?
sensuality.description: Using controlled substances deliberately impairs your God-given reason and free will, and an attempt to avoid dealing with life's challenges rather than facing them with God's help.

sensuality.question: Do I prioritize my own pleasures over God's will?
sensuality.description: This sin makes  idol of physical or emotional gratification, turning what should be a gift from God into the primary focus of one's life, displacing God as the center and highest good.

sensuality.question: Do I prioritize pleasures over my relationship with God, allowing them to become a central focus of my life?
sensuality.description: This sin makes  idol of physical or emotional gratification, turning what should be a gift from God into the primary focus of one's life, displacing God as the center and highest good.

sensuality.question: Do I allow my desire for physical comfort and relaxation to distract me from my spiritual well-being?
sensuality.description: This sin makes  idol of physical or emotional gratification, turning what should be a gift from God into the primary focus of one's life, displacing God as the center and highest good.

extracted_data_phrases: through means such as phone conversations ,

sensuality.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

murder.question: Did I harm anyone?
murder.description: The taking of one's life intentionally violates the fifth commandment and takes away the precious gift of life that was granted by God.

murder.question: Have I participated in an abortion?
murder.description: It's a grave sin to actively participate in the intentional taking of another's life, which robs the gift of life that was granted to others by God.

extracted_data_phrases: in a manner that respected their dignity and Catholic teaching on the reverence of human burial
on the reverence of human burial
impiety.question: Did I condone a funeral where a loved one's remains were not buried in a manner that respected their dignity and Catholic teaching on the reverence of human burial?
impiety.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

extracted_data_phrases: for the Most Blessed Sacrament , especially during Masses or Adorations
impiety.question: Did you fail to always show reverence for the Most Blessed Sacrament, especially during Masses or Adorations when it was present?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: especially during private visits or Adoration
by merely being present without proper attention and devotion

impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: in Eucharistic celebrations or other liturgical events
impiety.question: Did I fail to show proper reverence for the Most Blessed Sacrament when participating in Eucharistic celebrations or other liturgical events?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

scandal.question: Did I try to persuade someone else to engage in sinful behavior through my actions?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, harboring pride instead of surrendering to God's mercy?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: with personal failures or unmet expectations
in areas where I feel a sense of pride or identity
impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my own wrongdoing, even when faced with personal failures or unmet expectations in areas where I feel a sense of pride or identity?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

blasphemy.question: Did I, while sharing my personal experiences or feelings, swear to God?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while deliberately choosing to be in a state of sin?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

of serious personal sin , such as unresolved conflicts or unrepented wrongdoings

blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: in jest , or to express disrespect in conversation

blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly in situations where I had authority or influence
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I interacted with others, particularly in situations where I had authority or influence?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: in your leadership roles or volunteer positions
ambition.question: Did your desire for power and dominance in your leadership roles or volunteer positions influence how you treated others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulating wealth and possessions the driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make the accumulation of material possessions and wealth a driving force in my life, separating trust in God's providence from my faith?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Have I mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Did you through your deeds oppress, mistreat, or discriminate against others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: for your good fortune in life
autonomy.question: Did you take credit for your good fortune in life, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I harbor doubts about God's existence?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

autonomy.question: Did you entertain doubts about God's existence?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

extracted_data_phrases: without acknowledging God 's presence and guidance
autonomy.question: Did I trust solely in my own abilities without acknowledging God's presence and guidance, and thereby failed to seek His grace and wisdom in all my endeavors?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

extracted_data_phrases: especially in times of uncertainty or challenging situations
autonomy.question: Did I place my trust solely in my own abilities, neglecting to acknowledge and rely on God's assistance, especially in times of uncertainty or challenging situations?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

presumption.question: Did I assume that my accomplishments and successes were solely due to my own efforts, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence in guiding me?
presumption.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any genuine effort to change , merely relying on His forgiveness for your habitual sinful behavior
on His forgiveness for your habitual sinful behavior

presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in presuming God 's mercy without making any effort to change your habits
without making any effort to change your habits

presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in living your life without seeking God 's will

presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in a state of mortal sin
presumption.question: Did you delay making an act of contrition or going to confession while in a state of mortal sin, showing contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

presumption.question: Did I fail to teach my child their faith, leaving them without guidance in spiritual matters?
presumption.description: Parents have a primary and sacred duty to pass on the faith to their children, as they are considered their children's first and most important religious teachers who are directly responsible for their spiritual formation and eternal salvation.

extracted_data_phrases: at others ' accomplishments or possessions with discontent
envy.question: Have I ever looked at others' accomplishments or possessions with discontent, feeling they have something that I wish I had?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: with words that were unbecoming of your Christian dignity
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with words that were unbecoming of your Christian dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking negatively about others, even if what I said was true?

defraud.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

anger.question: Have I nursed anger against family members, friends, or neighbors rather than seeking reconciliation and forgiveness?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

infidelity.question: Have I broken my marriage vows by committing infidelity through deeds?

violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.
